clinical_study.brief_title: Taste and Smell Impairment in Critically Ill COVID-19 Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Taste and Smell Impairment in Critically Ill COVID-19 Patients
clinical_study.source: Sisli Hamidiye Etfal Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluating the smell and taste perceptions of patients hospitalized in the intensive care unit with suspicion of Coronavirus disease-19 diagnosis with a survey study

detailed_description.textblock: Patients who were treated in the intensive care unit of Şişli Hamidiye Etfal Training and Research Hospital with the diagnosis of Coronavirus disease-19 will be determined by scanning the hospital registry system. It was planned that patients discharged from the intensive care unit would be called by phone and their complaints about smell and taste disorders were evaluated with a questionnaire.

primary_outcome.description: incidence of taste and smell impairment in critically ill subjects

study_pop.textblock: Patients between the ages of 18-80, who were treated in the intensive care unit with the diagnosis of Coronavirus disease-19 and were discharged

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults between the ages of 18-80
- Agree to participate in the study
- Patients treated in the intensive care unit with the diagnosis of Coronavirus disease-19
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pre-existing smell and taste impairment
- The patients have no enough cooperation to answer the questionnaire
- Having additional diseases such as dementia and Alzheimer
